comment.author: 15283643@N04
comment._content:
Defiance was launched bow first into the Kennebec River at Bath, Maine on Monday, May 11, 1914. The christening ceremony was unusual. Miss Frances Clark stood on the deck and smashed a bottle of wine on the bow as the boat entered the water. (References: The Evening News, Providence, RI; The Day, New London, CT). 

Not the most auspicious launch.

The two thin mast-like poles were only temporary supports for the bunting.
